column1: tossed up on middle and leg, worked away past the left of mid-on for one
Babar hangs it up in the air, non-turning ball on off stump. Kamran hangs back and dabs to cover

Babar errs in length. Short and outside off, Kamran is super quick to pick the length up. Skips back and pulls it away to the right of mid-on for the first boundary of the night. Authoritative. Shot of a man in form
skids on with the arm outside off, slightly short, and Babar is punished again. Nails a square cut between cover-point and backward point on the back foot
Kamran makes room and slashes it. Can't beat the packed off-side infield now

three boundaries from the first over of the final. Kamran is strong on the back foot. Slightly short and outside off again, he moves back and cuts it between point and the covers. Poor start from Babar
back of a length and on the stumps, hangs back and punches in the direction of mid-off
Malan uses his feet, manufactures a very full length, a whirl of the wrists sends the ball to the right of deep square leg
back of a length and drifting down the leg side past the attempted pull. Leg-side wide from Anwar
dug in short and just a shade outside off, Malan connects with the pull now. Dispatched over midwicket. Clears the man in the deep
picked off the pads through the square-leg region
half-volley outside off, Malan leans into the drive and creams it away to the right of mid-off and to the left of extra-cover. This is some start from Peshawar
neither short nor wide enough for the cut. Back of a length and headed for the off stump, chopped limply to cover
back of a length and angled into the hips from over the wicket, nurdled square through the leg side for one
short and angling away outside off, the left-hander swings his hands at a pull. Drags the ball past midwicket off the inside half of the bat. He lost his shape while meeting the ball
short and on off, hint of extra bounce, Kamran opens the face and dabs the ball to point
shortish and veering into the hips, Kamran unfurls a handsome flick, beats deep square to his right. The ball is coming onto the bat nicely. Seems like a flat surface with plenty of runs on offer
good length on middle and leg, angled in, beats the inside edge and hits the pad as the batsman misses the flick now
back of a length and angled in on middle stump, Kamran is on the move as he softly plays it back to the bowler
hint of spin for Nawaz right away, whipped in the air over midwicket
quick dart outside off, short in length, so Kamran moves back and flashes to cover
skids on with the arm outside off, can't bowl short and wide to Kamran, he goes back and cuts it between point and cover. Precise placement
full and rolls on outside off, no turn, full, push-driven down to long-off for one
flat and breaking down the leg side, past the glance, wide
tossed up outside leg, Malan pre-meditates and under-edges a reverse-sweep. Nearly dragged it back onto the stumps
short and speared on off, Malan stays back and short-arms it away to midwicket
back of a length and angled in on off and middle, defended with a straight bat
Emrit ventures wide of the crease, angled down the leg side as the batsman does not make contact with a glance. Another leg-side wide. This is not helping Quetta's cause
full and comes in, possibly a slower ball, knocked into the leg side with soft hands

Emrit provides the breakthrough for Quetta. Welcome to Quetta, Emrit. Welcome to Lahore, Emrit. Sir Viv is animated in the Quetta dug out. Good length and holds its line outside off, from around the stumps, Malan attempts a back-foot force and this time he isn't lucky. Drags a thick inside edge back onto the stumps
Emrit sends down a bouncer outside off, leaves Samuels in a tangle. He spars at it and nicks it to the right of a diving Sarfraz. Fortunate boundary
fuller and on off, Samuels poked it to cover with minimal footwork
dropped short, keeps low on off, pulled away, mid-on fumbles, but just a single
good length ball angled in on the stumps, blocked back to the bowler on the back foot
pushed through, slides in to strike the pad
length ball drifts in around off, punched down to long-off
what was that? Shooter. Arm-ball from Babar, arrows in and sneaks under the bat. Sneaks past Sarfraz too
full, quick dart, this keeps low as well. Yikes, but Kamran jams his bat down on the ball and keeps it out
slides on off, jabbing drive to long-off for one
off-stump yorker, angled out to point
nice and full on off, pushed right back to the bowler
keeps it full on off, Kamran drives on the up, can't beat cover now
pulls his length back slightly, another non-turning ball, which is carved to cover
much shorter and outside off, Samuels flashes to the same fielder
full on off, presses forward and drives to cover
Kamran backs away outside the leg stump, Nawaz is wary of it as he hurls it short following him. Off the thigh and lobs behind to the keeper
fuller on the stumps, Kamran attempts a wild leg-side mow. Mistimed to long-on
non-turning fast ball on off, played back to the bowler
back of a length and outside off, Samuels camps back and punches a single to long-off
Kamran backs away outside leg, chops this from the stumps but can't get it past the sprawling dive of point

Anwar comes back and provides Peshawar with the release. Short and wide outside off, Kamran does not need any second invitations. He cuts in the air past the reach of backward point. The ball flies to the fence
back of a length and keeps low on off, played back down the pitch
short on off, Samuels does not have any room to work with. Punched past the outstretched left hand of Anwar
Kamran dashes down the track, but does not meet the pitch. Chips it to long-on's left
short and a bit more room outside off, but Samuels simply forces it back to the bowler
tight line on off, Samuels awkwardly blocks it back to the bowler
Kamran goes boom. He runs down the track, creates a half-volley and launches it straight over the bowler's head
now Kamran backs away, collapses is back leg and goes inside-out over cover
flighted and outside off, Samuels uses his feet now, closes the face and aims for the loft. The mis-hit goes over extra cover
flatter and quicker now, Samuels comes down the track again, lofts this strongly over long-on for a flat six
dropped short and turns away wide outside off, Samuels reaches out for the ball and scythes it away to deep point

Hassan hits back after being taken for three boundaries in the over. Quick arm-ball from the left-arm spinner. Kamran committed to the sweep and did not make contact. He was pinned in front of middle. As plumb as it can get

bowled'em. Two wickets in two balls for Quetta. Samuels isn't the man of this final? Ripper from Nawaz. This one pitches on leg stump, opens Samuels up, eats him up for dinner. The left-arm spinner hits the top of off stump. Sharp turn
whipped away to square leg
full and straight, worked to midwicket
short and angled in from over the wicket, beats the pull, and hits Nawaz high on the back thigh. Nawaz gestures a review, but we don't have DRS for the final
pushed through just a shade outside off, this does not spin, Shah opens the face and dabs to point
dragged short on off, Hafeez stands up tall and punches a single to long-off
good length on off, played back to the bowler
extra-cover dives over the ball as this drive runs away to wide long-off
tossed just a shade outside off, pushed to mid-on on the front foot

Stumped off a wide.The left-arm spinners Hassan and Nawaz are turning the tables on Peshawar. Shah shows his ace early, dances out. Hassan pulls his length back significantly and darts it down the leg side. Leg-side wide. Shah can't touch it. Sarfraz does the rest. Excellent comeback from Quetta
nearly a return catch. Unfair to call it a drop. Tossed up, dips on the batsman as he spoons the ball to the left of the bowler. He throws himself to his left but the ball does not stick
worked to midwicket
short on middle, punched down the ground for one
tossed up liberally on middle, tapped past the bowler's right
dug short and outside off, Hafeez is quick to rock back. Pulls in the air to deep midwicket
looped up, drifts in, as opposed to turning away. Beats the inside edge and hits the pad
short and darted in, hangs back and forces the ball to midwicket
slider on off stump, chopped square through the off side on the back foot
full and headed for the off stump, defended back to Babar
dragged short and outside off, pulled on the back foot to deep midwicket
flighted and drifts in, the batsman eyes the leg side and leading-edges it to long-off
good length on off, blocked back to the bowler
full-toss on off, forced away with the wrists, Nasim runs to his left from wide long-on and lets the ball sneak through his legs to the boundary
slightly short on middle and leg stylishly pulled to deep square leg
shortish and outside off, cuts on the back foot past a diving backward point for four. 11 runs off the over
tossed up full on off, jabbed to cover
more round-arm than usual, darted in, worked to leg
fractionally short on off, firmly pulled to deep midwicket on the back foot
arm-ball, short on off, cramps the batsman for room. Chopped out to cover
full-toss on off, hacked to long-on
good length, drifts in, beats the inside edge and raps the thigh
full and slipping down leg - possibly a slower ball - wide
just short of a good length and outside off, Ahmed throws his hands at a cut and miscues it to cover
back of a length on off, solidly punched past the left of a diving midwicket to long-on
short and outside off, stylishly pulled away to deep square leg
possibly a slower short ball outside off, the batsman sways his upper body out of the way
short and outside off, flat-batted away to cover
yorker down the leg side, wide. There was a clicking noise - perhaps came from bat hitting pad
slightly short on off, shovel-pulled away to deep midwicket
back of a length on off, whipped to deep midwicket
short and outside off, the ball isn't coming into the bat now. Heaved to deep midwicket

The Professor's lecture is over! Two fielders converge on the ball - deep midwicket running to his left and long-on running in - Nawaz pouches it running in from long-on. Emrit dug it short and outside off, Hafeez has to fetch a pull. Ends up skying a catch

Emrit produces a double-strike. Takes this third of the match. Nice and full, angled in from over the stumps, sort of skids on, Ahmed plays across the line and does not touch the ball. He is trapped in front of middle. This was plumb too
good length, angled in, and seams away outside off, past the loose waft
Emrit rolls his fingers across this cutter and beats Jordan again
slides on, very full on off, forward-defensive
pushed through full on off, stops on the batsman, Sammy lines up for a big loft, then checks his shot and pushes the ball along the ground to long-off
turn and bounce outside off, jumps past the hanging bat. Excellent bowling from Nawaz
tossed up slower on off, bunted down to long-on. Jordan eyes two. No, it's not there
back of a length on off, punched to cover, the fielder (Ervine) looks up before collecting the ball and fumbles. Sammy sneaks a single. A clean pick-up from Ervine could have created a run-out chance
fired fast and outside off, Jordan swings and does not connect. What a spell from Nawaz. He finishes with 4-0-15-1 in a big final
back of a length and outside off, Sammy clubs it away in the direction of deep square leg
length and outside off, Sammy clears his front leg and looks to mow it down the ground. Ends up getting a thick outside edge that flies past a diving Sarfraz. First boundary since the 14th over
short and outside off, Sammy ends up dragging a pull to deep midwicket
short of a length on off stump, Jordan places the pull well, finding the gap between deep square and deep midwicket. It wasn't middled, though
full slower ball, jags in and hits the pad
full on off stump - right in the hitting slot - Sammy sizes it up. Opens up his hips and tugs the ball towards the sightscreen. 18 runs off the over
yorker just outside off, Jordan can only squeeze a single square through the off side
length and outside off, Sammy unleashes his power again. He sits deep in the crease and swings it stylishly over long-on. What a clean strike
Sammy does it again. Chants of 'Sammy Sammy' at the Gadaffi Stadium. Just short of a good length and outside off, Sammy clobbers it, clears long-on
Anwar replies with an inch-perfect off-stump yorker, dug out. Sammy applauds Anwar after taking the single
another off-stump yorker, top ball, squeezed back to Anwar who fumbles to his left. Just one
pretty full and outside off, it was in the hitting slot, Sammy swings at it again. Loses his shape and connects with only thin air. They don't chance the bye either
back of a length and outside off, slashed to point
pitched up and outside off, encourages the drive. Forward and stroked to mid-off
some swing for Hasan. Nice and full, shapes away outside off, past the flash
length ball on off, jabbing drive to mid-off
back of a length on off, Hasan cramps Shehzad for room. Played back to the bowler
keeps it on a back of a length on off stump, Shehzad punchily drives a single to mid-off
starts off with a full non-turning ball, misses the sweep, hit on the front pad outside the line of off I think. He weathers the lbw appeal
full on middle, pushed to midwicket

short fine leg swoops down on the ball and nails a direct hit. Excellent work from Hasan, catches Van Wyk short. The batsman uses his feet, attempts a flick, and inside-edges the ball to Hasan. Van Wyk eyes a risky single but it sent back by Shehzad. He can't make it in time
tossed up on off, defended back
full and outside off, tapped to cover on the front foot
full and around off, push-driven to long-off
Down the track, heaves at the ball and squirts an inside edge to long leg
slower short ball outside off, might have been a cutter, slashes early in the air to the left of backward point. Yes, this  offcutter gripped in the surface
that's a gem! Good length, angled in, and cuts away viciously past the outside edge. Unplayable

Sammy drops a catch at slip! Pitched up and outside off, Shehzad reaches out for a drive, plays away from the body, and nicks it behind. The ball hits Sammy's chest and goes down. It just flew to slip. Sammy was late to react
back of a length and angled in, Anumul eyes the leg side and ends up squirting a leading edge towards point
short on off, hits the splice of the bat, the ball rolls to mid-on

The reprieve costs Peshawar just one run. Anamul holes out to long-off. Jordan is a quality fielder, be it in the slip cordon or in the outfield. Anamul uses his feet, does not get close enough to the pitch. He aimed to hit it squarer, ended up punting it straighter to long-off
slower and turns outside off, forward and pushed to cover
quicker and angled in on middle and leg, worked to leg
Sarfraz shows intent. Jumps outside leg, manufactures room, takes this from outside off and flays a square-cut
tossed up on off, Sarfraz jumps down the track and dares to go against the spin. Smacks it over midwicket
lobbed up outside off, pushed back to the bowler on the front foot
back of a length and angled in on off, punched to cover

Hasan bounces out Shehzad. Quetta lose their top three inside five overs. Shehzad is being asked to wait. The umpires check for a possible no-ball. It looks tight. Think the foot is on the line. The benefit of the doubt should go to Hasan. TV umpire Raza ultimately sends Shehzad back. Quick short ball on off, aimed at the chest of Shehzad. He is late onto the pull, ends up top-edging it to midwicket
back of a length and outside off,  punched in the direction of midwicket
back of a length and seams away outside off, past the outside edge
back of a length and outside off, presses forward and punchily drives it in the gap at cover
short and outside off, dragged away to deep square leg
full on off, nudged to deep square leg
Sarfraz pre-meditates shuffling outside the leg stump and slashing this fine of short third man
tossed up on off, Sarfraz stretches forward and sweeps it up and over square leg

One shot too many from Sarfraz? He has to go. Hafeez leaves Quetta four down. Sarfraz rushes down the track and attempts a big hack. Hafeez lobs it up just outside off and gets it to dip at the charging batsman. Sarfraz misses, Kamran swipes the bails off
flighted offbreak outside off, patted to point
flatter and faster on middle and leg, whipped out to deep midwicket
short on off, stays back and knocks it to midwicket
back of a length on off, poked to leg for one
full on the pads, flicked away to mid-on
short on off, pulled on the back foot to deep midwicket
slower awaycutter, hangs back and dabs to point
rising short ball on off, Nasim rises with it and fends to cover-point
back of a length and on off stump, no room to work with, played back to the bowler

Quetta five down and sinking. One Lahore boy takes down another. Full on middle, the loft was on, but the execution was bad. The bat twisted in his hands, so Nasim got more height as opposed to distance. Picks out Ahmed at long-on
very full on middle and leg, clipped away through midwicket
rapid short ball aimed at the chest, fended
short on middle, blocked back to the bowler
keeps it short, the line is outside off, played with soft hands to cover
full and straight, clipped away to deep midwicket
Ervine skips down the track, meets the pitch, and drives inside-out over extra cover. Laced it
pushed through on off, inside-edged square through on leg
short on off, forced down to long-on
whipped from off stump to long-on
slides on middle and leg, clipped away through square leg
short and wide outside off, stabbed away to backward point, where Hafeez dives full-length to his right to stop the ball
dug short and just outside off, arches his back, uses the pace of Wahab to his advantage, and ramps it to the third-man fence
Anwar opens the bat-face and secures a single down to third man
back of a length and outside off, guided down to deep third man
Wahab slams a short ball on middle, defended back to the bowler
full and outside off, driven to cover. The score is 55 for 5.
short and angled in on off, punched down to long-off
down the track, the bowler shortens his length, hit to long-on
speared short and outside off, square-cut away for one
Ervine steps away outside leg, takes a shortish ball from outside off, and slices through cover-point
near yorker outside off, jabbed to cover
short and angled in on off, Anwar sits back and deflects the ball behind square on the leg side
back of a length and angled in on middle and leg, Anwar crouches and dabs a single to midwicket
short and outside off, this is more a short-arm flap than a short-arm pull as the ball rolls behind square
back of a length and angled in on middle, grazes the pad and sneaks away fine on the off side. Height was an issue. Think it was slipping down leg as well
with fine leg inside the circle you can't bowl on leg stump. Slower cutter, glanced fine of short fine leg
back of a length on the hips, pulled to the right of short fine leg
Anwar moves outside leg, Jordan follows him and pings the pad as the ball wanders away square through the off side
short and angled in on middle, nudged to short fine leg
Ervine uses his feet, the left-armer drags his length back and strikes the thigh
full on off, hint of turn, Anwar opens the bat-face and steers towards backward point

Asghar returns and takes down Ervine. He celebrates the wicket with a fist pump. Sammy is pumped too. Poor shot from Ervine. He backs away outside leg, exposing his stumps. Then looks to cut a ball that isn't really short. Looks to cut against the spin. Eventually, he does not make contact. The ball skids on and it's timbaaah

stumping chance sent upstairs. Tossed up and drifts away outside off, drags Nawaz forward and goes past the outside edge. Kamran collects the ball and takes the bails off. Nawaz loses his balance and lifts his back leg. Seems like the foot is on the line by the time the bails come off. Tough one for Raza, the TV umpire. Out is the verdict. Two wickets in two balls, Peshawar are closing in on the title
lobbed up on off, Asghar hangs it in the air, drops down, no turn, defended with a straight bat. Asghar finishes with 3 for 16
slower full-toss outside off, carved to the off-side sweeper
skiddy short ball on middle, attempts a pull, and mis-times it to square leg
short of a length and outside off, swiped to deep midwicket
slower short ball outside off, hip-high delivery, Anwar waits for the ball to arrive and swats it disdainfully between long-on and deep midwicket
seam-up short ball outside off, bounces over the cut of the batsman
short of a length, attached with width outside off, cut straight to backward point
back of a length, angled in, and straightens away outside off. Jumps past the outside edge
short and cramps the batsman for room. Pulled, but not off the middle, to deep midwicket

Peshawar are just two away from victory. No Anwar Ali rescue act. Short of a length and skids on outside off, Anwar is late onto the pull. He eyes up midwicket and ends up top-edging a catch to extra-cover
short on off stump, pulled on the back foot to long-on
short on middle and leg, cramps 'em up for room. Fended behind square on the leg side
back of a length on off, twirls his wrists and whips to deep midwicket
short rising ball on off stump, hustles the batsman for pace. Tickled towards point
short on middle, Rayad gets inside the line and swats to short fine leg
short and rapid on middle, flat-batted to mid-off
short and just outside off, upper-cuts and does not connect
short and whizzes past the helmet as the batsman arches back and leaves. Too high and called a wide
Peshawar are just one away from securing the title. Wahab beats another batsman for pace. Chest-hunting short ball on the leg stump, Hasan simply lobs a catch to Sammy at midwicket
back of a length and outside off, crunched through the covers
short and outside off, smeared away to deep midwicket, straight to the fielder

Peshawar Zalmi are the champions of the second season of the PSL! The fireworks go off, and Sammy calls his boys for the selfie celebration. Then every Peshawar player attempts the Afridi star-man pose. The crowd goes berserk. Well done, Peshawar. They rejoice further. It was Hasan who set it up with the new ball and sealed it with the old one. This was full and right on the off stump. Babar looks to slug it away across the line. He only connects with a whole lot of thin air. The off stump is tilted back
